Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from two fragments) of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior glazed black; exterior: glazed black on rim; handle zone reserved save for added red band at top; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B3
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies the sherd as coming from a Type 9C South Ionian cup with everted rim. Type 9C cups correspond to Attic Siana or Gordion cups and find parallels with Hayes' Ionian Cup Type X (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Vallet and Villard's Ionian Cup type B3 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. Type 5 cups are rare at Naukratis whereas there are numerous examples of Type 9 cups. Both types were common drinking vessels found in Greeks sanctuaries, including the sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus. For parallels, see British Museum 1888,06.01.251 and 1888,0601.241.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pl. 23.1.39)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 52, no. 282)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.705) (Phase 3)
